attributes.action: Provide as much oxygen as possible from our excess to Indian hospitals.
attributes.additional_details: As India is a fellow democratic nation we have economic and geopolitical interest in we should provide aid as we do with any other national disaster that occurs. We have a duty to assure that democracy prevails and to do so the best way is to aid other democratic nations in their time of crisis. India played a crucial role in producing AZ vaccines for both our own and global supplies. We cannot leave their people or nation in dismay for both our global ideals and interests. Help end suffering.
attributes.background: With the oxygen crisis that many Indian hospitals are facing we must aid them. I propose that we analyse the amount our own hopsitals have in excess, if any, and decide what would be feasible to donate without putting our NHS at risk. Financial aid should be bare minimum if nothing else.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Increase support for India in the Covid Crisis: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/584152

Send excess equipment to countries in humanitarian covid crisis: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/584188

Once priority groups in the UK are vaccinated redirect Covid-19 vaccines abroad: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/572802

You may be interested to know that on 25 April the Government announced that it was sending medical equipment to India to support the country in its fight against COVID-19: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/uk-sends-life-saving-medical-equipment-to-india
